item.title: BMW Plans $2.8 Billion China Factory Update to Boost EV Production
item.description: BMW will invest $2.76 billion to adapt one of its major Chinese factories to produce more electric vehicles in the world’s largest EV market.

item.title: Hong Kong Shares Rise 0.5%, Led by Property Stocks
item.description: The Hang Seng closed 0.5% higher, led by property stocks, with sentiment likely supported by news of another city in China easing curbs on home buying, which has raised market expectations that other Tier-1 cities will follow suit, Daiwa said.

item.title: Euro, Sterling Perform Well Against Dollar as Rate Divergence Is Now Priced in
item.description: In contrast to the recent weak performance of the yen, the euro and sterling have been rising against the dollar, with the expectation that the U.S. will cut interest rates later than the eurozone and U.K. now priced in to markets, MUFG said.

item.title: Oil Falls on U.S. Inflation Concerns
item.description: Oil prices traded lower in Europe after the latest U.S. data reinforced prospects of higher-for-longer interest rates, but signs of a tightening physical market limited the downside.

item.title: Metal Prices Are Mixed as Gold Slips on Easing Tensions
item.description: Gold futures slipped on easing safe-haven demand as geopolitical tensions eased and investors focus was on U.S. inflation.

item.title: Euro Bank Credit Spreads Seen Tightening on Monday, Driven By Positive Earnings
item.description: Eurozone bank bonds are expected to perform well on Monday, with credit spreads seen tightening, supported by solid earnings and positive news on France’s credit rating, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: Glynn's Take: RBA in a Quandary About What to Do Next
item.description: The fog blanketing Australia’s economic outlook has thickened, leaving the country’s central bank in a quandary about which direction to next take interest rates.

item.title: French Government to Buy Some Atos Assets
item.description: Atos said the French state planned to acquire part of its big data and security arm for up to €1 billion as it seeks to raise more cash.

item.title: Hipgnosis Backs Improved Blackstone Offer
item.description: Hipgnosis, home to the catalog of artists such as Neil Young, Shakira and Red Hot Chili Peppers, has agreed to an improved $1.6 billion takeover by Blackstone, trumping a rival bid from Apollo-backed music company Concord Chorus.

item.title: EU Raises Competition Concerns Over IAG, Air Europa Tie-Up
item.description: IAG’s planned €400 million acquisition of Air Europa could reduce competition, the EU said, concerned that customers could face increased prices and lower quality service.

item.title: Vivendi Posts Group-Wide Revenue Growth
item.description: Vivendi recorded a 5% revenue rise in the first quarter, with growth driven by the consolidation of Lagardere and strong performances at Canal+ and Havas.

item.title: Tesla Wins China's Backing for Driver-Assistance Service
item.description: Tentative approval for the “Full Self-Driving” software feature follows Elon Musk’s unannounced visit to Beijing and a meeting with the Chinese premier.

item.title: BBVA Lifts Outlook After First-Quarter Profit Beat
item.description: BBVA raised its profit target for the year after first-quarter results came in above consensus expectations, helped by a 15% rise in net interest income.

item.title: Philips Settles U.S. Ventilator Claims
item.description: Philips has reached a $1 billion settlement in the U.S. related its Respironics ventilators, and backed its full-year guidance.

item.title: Yen Rebounds After Hitting 34-Year Low of 160 to Dollar in Thin Trade
item.description: The Japanese yen bounced back sharply after briefly hitting a low of 160 against the dollar on waning expectations for near-term rate increases from the Bank of Japan.

item.title: Egypt offered a new proposal for a truce between Israel and Hamas in which some Israeli hostages would be released in exchange for Palestinian prisoners and a three-week cease-fire.
item.description: Egypt offered a new proposal for a truce between Israel and Hamas in which some Israeli hostages would be released in exchange for Palestinian prisoners and a three-week cease-fire.

item.title: Restocking the U.S. armory to replace weapons sent to Ukraine is setting up growth in the U.S. defense industry for years to come.
item.description: Restocking the U.S. armory to replace weapons sent to Ukraine is setting up growth in the U.S. defense industry for years to come.

item.title: TikTok failed to avert a sale or ban of its operations in the U.S. in part due totectonic shifts in U.S.-China relations and coordinated, stealthy efforts by the app's critics on Capitol Hill.
item.description: TikTok failed to avert a sale or ban of its operations in the U.S. in part due to tectonic shifts in U.S.-China relations and coordinated, stealthy efforts by the app’s critics on Capitol Hill.

item.title: Individual U.S. states, invoking grassroots Americandistrust of the Chinese Communist Party, are taking action to block Chinese land purchases, factory plans and research in their jurisdictions.
item.description: Individual U.S. states, invoking grassroots American distrust of the Chinese Communist Party, are taking action to block Chinese land purchases, factory plans and research in their jurisdictions.

item.title: Biden spoke with Netanyahu to reiterate U.S. concerns about a widespread invasion of Rafah and discuss prospects for a deal.
item.description: Biden spoke with Netanyahu to reiterate U.S. concerns about a widespread invasion of Rafah and discuss prospects for a deal.
